intro: Siphocampylus biserratus var. spicatus, commonly known as the spiculate siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested habitats. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
